descriptions.overview: With your Google Home device, you can have your own personal assistant. With simple voice commands, you can get information about traffic, sports, finance and more. Google Home allows you stream videos directly to your television, set alarms, play music and ask for directions all from the comfort of your own home. Simply say "OK Google" and ask your question. Within seconds, Google Home will return you an answer. Easily control your Chromecast device or Nest thermostat (not included) with your voice. Included is a HiFi sound quality speaker and a far-field microphone.
list: Google Home is powered by the Google Assistant, ask it questions, tell it to do things, it’s your own Google, always ready to help just start by saying Ok Google
With a simple voice command, play tunes from services like YouTube Music and Google Play Music, enjoy even more compatible audio services by streaming directly from your phone to Google Home
Get answers to things you want to know including the latest on weather, traffic, finance, sports, and more, plus get information to help you do things in your world
With your permission, Google Home can help you with things like your commute, flight information, and more, plus it’s a whiz at setting alarms, starting timers, and adding items to your shopping list
Simply ask Google Home to stream videos to your TV with Chromecast or to turn up your Nest thermostat
Google Home’s high excursion speaker delivers HiFi sound quality, It can also hear you reliably thanks to far-field microphones

reviews.title: "Google home"
reviews.text:
Product arrived and I was skeptical as to whether we would use it. Boy, were we surprised. We use it for everything from checking the weather, help with homework assignments and especially playing music. The installation was super easy. The sound quality is great. So easy to use even my grand-daughter uses it to answer her questions. 

I would highly recommend this product. I have found out that it easily recognized all the voices in our family after following the installation instructions.

Easy to install and use. Installation took less than 10 minutes from unwrapping to use.
reviews.author: TV

reviews.title: "Depending on your needs, it's a great product"
reviews.text: I have this and several Amazon Echos. I personally think this sounds better, more bassy. It also looks quite a bit better in the kitchen. Like all personal assistants it answers some questions better than others. It has a good amount of tie ins to 3rd party services and of course to Google services. I do prefer the manual rotary dial on the Echo, but the touch surface works good enough. For the price you get a lot and they are consistently expanding services. It even integrates with Lowe's Iris products. Not sure why the site keeps putting my picture sideways.
reviews.author: Tony

reviews.title: "Home sweet home"
reviews.text: I've had a google home since they came out and love it. great music, controls my hue lights and answers questions like a champ. this one I customized to match our bedroom which is another nice extra. I have only 2 suggestions. first at full volume like my wife enjoys it has a lot of trouble recognizing "hello Google" even when I yell. second all my devices including my phone and other rooms try to answer at the same time. I still highly recommend this for yourself or a gift.
reviews.author: Bryce

reviews.title: "1st user of google home"
reviews.text:
I was excited when I got my google home. Having tried Alexa in the past, I wanted to see how this would compare. The packaging was amazing and the install was super simple. I had to download the app to my Android phone and Apple Ipad. 

The Pros:
I took a few minutes to set up the google home but very user friendly. Google home is the right size for the space I have it in, It's not bulky nor takes up a lot of space. I like the features that google home has. I can set an alarm or alerts. I travel often so having access to the weather quickly is a plus. I can play both spotify and pandora, google also lets you call individuals on your contact list.

The Cons:
If I am not using the wifi on my android I am not able to access google home on my device, It will not show up unless the wifi in on.
reviews.author: Foster

reviews.title: "Google Home Review - Google Wins"
reviews.text:
Google Home: Been using this for about 5 weeks. This is the standard version of the Google Home devices. (Max is top tier, Mini is smaller version). The Home works well as a speaker and smart device. It provides weather, trivia, music, and compares well with all smart home devices. Google is easy to trust with their line of technology products.

We have two minis, a Home, and a Home Max in the house. This can be confusing if you're trying to play music as you typically set one device as the primary music speaker. If you're in the bedroom and ask to play music, it will often begin playing in the living room. I'm still trying to figure that out. It could be 'user error'.
You can link multiple music accounts (Pandora, Google Music, Spotify + more) to your Google Device. You do have to be specific when asking it, otherwise it will go to the default setting.

Pros: All standard smart home routines work great (similar to Alexa). Speakers are good and better than your phone or the Alexa Dot we were using. The morning and evening 'routines' are great. You can configure Google to give you weather, traffic, news, play selected music, or none of the above each morning or night just by saying, "Hey Google - Good Morning or Good Night". *Good night also asks what time to set your alarm and will play various sleeping music. These features alone make us like it more than the Alexa Dot. I do like the touch feature for volume and play/pause on the top. This faster than voice commands if you're nearby. 

Cons: Having multiple devices can be confusing as to which speaker will play music for you but the sound quality is better than the competitor's products. Having multiple music website choices force you to be specific when asking for a specific song and if your 14 year old daughter makes changes, then it's changed for everyone. >: Ha-ha. 

Random: Alexa seemed to have more corny jokes and a daily fun fact as part of her 'Good Morning' routine. I miss this but the Google Good Morning routine is better and more functional, in my opinion.

Size: (see photos) It is very similar in size/shape to my wife's essential oils diffuser. Not sure if it made sense to pair them together but it works. I included a photo beside a standard water bottle to show the size because the box is larger than the actual device. This is not too bulky and could go anywhere but does require a power cord. 

Overall: We are really enjoying the Google Home experience. We really enjoyed the Alexa Dot but Google, in typical Google fashion, has extra perks that rate it ahead, in my opinion.
reviews.author: BAintheBoro

reviews.title: "Fun and Entertaining, need to support Samsung Tv"
reviews.text: works pretty well for what ever we speak. it understands every thing. some times doesn't recognise when we push volume to high and play something and ask some questions. Calling feature is added which is pretty awesome. Unable to connect to my Samsung tv. would be perfect if it comments.Audio output is pretty good compared to competetion.

The ECHO was out of stock at the time so I decided to try out the Google home. The Google home can answers a lot more questions, stock, eta traffic, etc.. however can not understand you as well as the Amazon products. Both choices will get smarter and better. Love the idea for both units.

reviews.title: "A critical piece in any home automation system"
reviews.text: I used it with SmartThings and Harmony Hub to control my lights and TV.  It can even close my garage.  Albeit if you want it to control you home you will need to spend money on other gadgets (i.e. SmartThings, Harmony Hub, etc.)  It is also very useful by itself.  It can answer many questions the Amazon Echo doesn't even come close to answering.  It only gets better with updates.  I'm waiting for the price to go down to get a second one.
reviews.author: Johnny

reviews.title: "Still developing"
reviews.text: Works good for playing music at a moderate level or setting an alarm. Does the same thing as the other devices in the google series. Would hold off on buying it till you have more devices.
reviews.author: Jer

reviews.title: "Hey Google, You Are Awesome"
reviews.text: I love my Google Home. I can ask about the weather, how to spell a word, add reminders/appointments to my Google calendar, ask it to play songs, Google all kinds of questions and tell it to add something to my grocery list. I have the Home app on my phone so when I go to the store my grocery list is already there. My kids and hubby can't easily say, "Hey Google, add (whatever item) to my list, and it will show up even while I'm at the grocery store. Now there are no more excuses for not adding something to the list. I'm going to get a Chromecast so I can control my TV.
reviews.author: VeronicaC

reviews.title: "Google Home"
reviews.text:
I have been very impressed with the ease of set up of all the Google products. The easy start card is just that easy. 

This unit is larger than the Mini and has better sound, richer base tones, and is Bluetooth capable. I t also has two mikes built in so it picks up your commands better. If this was to be your first unit I would say good choice. If it was an add on then consider the two Mini pack. The sound is not that much better.

At first these units were just neat to have, but as I get more accustomed to them I find it more and more convenient to use.

I love being in a room and asking Google to play music from Pandora and just relaxing.
reviews.author: ToyMan

reviews.title: "Great Home Assistant"
reviews.text: Great product, not just to get answers. I can control all kinds of products feom Lights,  Sprinklers, door locks, thermostats, cameras and much more. If you have and use a Gmail account for your calendar and mail, this will make your day much easier by letting you know what's going on in your day even to make calls and detail recipes for you to cook. I definitely recommend over older similar products. 5 stars.
reviews.author: JoeShmoe

reviews.title: "Like Having a Smart Friend"
reviews.text: The Google Home is a great unit to have for setting alarms, listening to your favorite tunes, and asking questions like what's the temperature or how many cups in a quart. Just say "hey Google" and tell it to play some B.B. King on YouTube Music or Spotify or even your favorite FM station, set the volume with your voice. I've found this to be a very helpful item and I'm surprised how often I ask it something. Just a couple of weeks and it's become normal. I'm a 72 year old retiree but found this unit amazingly easy to set up and use. The Home system does require a cellphone app and wi-fi but nowadays most homes meet those requirements.
reviews.author: Jim

reviews.text: I have received this product and I'm going to start out by saying it sounds pretty darn good. The set up and features along with this product remade simple with Wi-Fi set up. When you just talk into the Google part of it with the Google commands it recognizes your sound of the voice. Via the app you can add distinct features you would like to accommodate your unit. The packaging part of the home was not a box with little to no moment. I would recommend this product to friends and family. Crank the music and relax is what the Google is made for.
reviews.author: catman600

reviews.title: "Awesome Product. Very Sensitive Responsive Mic."
reviews.text: Product works as expected and can be used handily if you are tied to the Google ecosystem. It also works with a range of third party accessories for home automation. The only downside that I can foresee is that it can only be tied to one account instead of having multiple for different people in a household.
reviews.author: Josh

reviews.title: "The Must Have Of all Google Items"
reviews.text:
The Google home device is the brains of of your goggle products in a way. It can send and control all of your Google devices as well as many other brands of wireless devices made today. A great thing that has been added is a remote battery that can last up to 8 hours of use. Here is a link to it. (https://ninety7.com/products/loft-portable-battery-base-for-google-home?gclid=CjwKCAiA0uLgBRABEiwAecFnk5RSzBeGIKnc5yx0fnDC091HWaG9163MG-r1fKGMDcI7l07yJs8eXhoCFDgQAvD_BwE&variant=52869588619)
With this you can take control anywhere in or out of your home and not have to worry about plugging it in for power and control. This is very easy to set up, download the Google App to what ever phone you may be using to set this up. Once you have the app downloaded and your Home Device plugged in, the App will do most of the work for you. It will ask you easy questions that you answer with the App. It will automatically connect to the WiFi you select, no passwords needed and its ready to go. As you add more devices to your system you will be able to do some amazing things that other systems can not do. You can use it as a intercom in your home. So if you have Google Minis in each bedroom you can just say ( OK GOOGLE BROADCAST) and then what ever you say will be heard on every Google Item in your home. One other great thing you can do is Broadcast from your phone from anywhere to your devices at home. Saying something like, I will be home in 10 minutes, be ready for dinner. Everyone will instantly know your on your way. I don't know any other devices that can do this for the great price you can buy this system for. You can constantly add more devices to your system as you want. What more can I ask for? Its a great price, easy to use and controls 100s of items. Many items that you can not get to work with the competitors controllers can be controlled by Google Home!
reviews.author: Bomber1955

reviews.title: "confusing"
reviews.text:
I will admit that I'm NOT a computer genius, but all these Google Home products are IMPOSSIBLE to get working. I tried for nearly 2 weeks to get the products to function, with no luck. The odd thing is, I had NO PROBLEM installing and using Alexia, you simply download the app and connect, not with GOOGLE. I just found out today (1-2-19) that Google does NOT allow you to download and install ANY of its products on a Laptop OR Desktop computer, you MUST use a Tablet. Which is a complete joke, now I have to go buy a tablet if I want to use any of the Google products I have, (Home assistant, google TV, Mini, Speaker, etc.).
NOT HAPPY............................
reviews.author: fix-it-guy

reviews.title: "A GREAT START TO A SMART HOME"
reviews.text:
BACKGROUND: I had been researching the smart home devices and systems but was unsure which company to use. The opportunity to evaluate the Google Home was too good to pass up. By the time is was over we had seven (7) different devices. 
FIT AND FINISH: I received the Home Chalk color, an off-white, which is unobtrusive. This is the poster child of Google Home for me. Bigger than the Mini, smaller than the Max, it provides the “Just right” functionality of a smart device.
INSTALLATION: Simple. Take the unit out of the box, download the Google Home app, plug in the power, and follow the instructions in the app. 
OPERATION: The app is the main control point for the device and offers several customization features. 
The Home offers all the smart home capabilities of the other Google Home devices. If's sound ability is deeper and louder than the Mini, but not so awe inspiring as the Max. I have it in my office and it is perfect for quiet mood music or louder concert music. I think the sound quality is equal to the smaller Bose speakers I have been a fan and user of since the ‘90s.
Google home devices are advertised as a voice recognition devices and all devices (Home, Mini, Max, Hub) provide the same Smart Home features, although Home Hub has a display. I found the Home great at voice recognition. You can train the Home to recognize your voice. Even with conversations in a room it can distinguish a voice it is trained to. When you associate different personal accounts, mail, calendar, and media streaming the Home creates a personalized response. If I ask for my schedule it give me my calendar information. My wife receives her calendar schedule. The Home will respond to other voices but will not give personalized information. 
There is a learning curve associated with how to ask for a response. There is a lot of information on the internet, but no definitive source. (See CONS below.)
PROS: Fairly easy to set up and use. Provides smart home control. Good sound and quality! "Broadcast" function acts like a home intercom! I used the broadcast function, via Google assistant to talk with my son while I was several miles away! And with a Mini in my shop my wife and I can communicate quickly.
CONS: It is difficult to determine what the Google home systems can do. There is no easily accessible manual, list of features, or troubleshooting. To me this is a major drawback to a voice response system. Too many times I asked for something and got a response like “I'm sorry, I can't do that yet.” The main point of contact is the Google support website chat feature. I found the chat to be helpful, but very time consuming. I even asked the chat technician where I could find the answer to a question online and he was unable to find it via publicly accessible means. Ironic I can't Google an answer for a Google product!
SUMMARY: If you want a Smart Home device, the Google Home is a good answer.
reviews.author: Pete

reviews.title: "Easy to set up the Home, so many ways to use it"
reviews.text: I got a Google Home to use in my family room so I can ask the Google Assistant to tell me the news and local weather and play music while I'm eating breakfast. It was very easy to setup and doesn't take up much space. I first downloaded the Google Home app on my smart phone, launched it, and added my information. Then I plugged in the Home and added it to the Home in the app after it connected to the WiFi. As a test, I asked the Assistant what the weather forecast was and it told me. Looking forward to learning about all the other ways I can use the Home and Google Assistant such as adding a Home Mini and grouping them together to play music throughout the house.
reviews.author: scooter55

reviews.title: "Google Home Device"
reviews.text: I am extremely pleased with the Google home device that I have received under the Lowe's loop program for evaluation and have found it to be far superior to the Alexa devices that I have in my home and office.I am also very honored and thankful to Lowe's loop program for offering me this device for evaluation and usage. The Google home Device I received works very well with other Google devices that I have throughout my home and office and I'm very pleased with its performance and would recommend it to anyone who is looking for an alternative method of controlling other Wi-Fi devices throughout their home and office .
reviews.author: Mike

reviews.title: "This is very handy to have around"
reviews.text: Our family loves our Google Home. My 9 year old likes to ask it questions all the time, or how to spell certain words. It can not detect my daughters little 4 year old voice, which upsets her :) We mostly use our google home to listen to music or set timers. You can play a fun trivia game, set alarms etc. She is still learning a lot, but we find her very helpful in our home.
reviews.author: Shell

reviews.title: "Very cool love my smart home"
reviews.text: Set up was so easy already have a google account, download the google home app plug it in connected to WiFi so fast. About 6inches tall doesn't take up much room om my counter and looks like a fancy air freshener. Love the colors when listening to me. My favorite part she understood my New England accent all the time. I asked tons of questions and for the most answered all of them . I'm using it as my daily reminders and it's doing its job. Tried out all the different voices but like the original the best. Although this is very new in my house and still learning I think I'm going to love my new tech home very much.
reviews.author: Kathy

reviews.title: "Space saving instant assistant"
reviews.text: This is a great space saving instant assistant that you can use hands free. Right out of the box and simple set up and down load the app on my phone we were done setting up in about 15min. The longest part was deciding where we should place this Home in the house. Make play lists for every member of the house and have party play lists for kids and adult parties. Love being able to ask for help and tips while cooking so I do not have to stop what I am doing. The kids love it to help with doing homework. The sleek design fits in well where ever you place it as it has slim lines and fits easy on a bookshelf or table.
reviews.author: ArmyTaekwondoMom

reviews.title: "Better Than The Echo"
reviews.text: I have both the GglHome & Amz.Echo, and as far as sound, and only having to ask the device once (not multiple times like you're talking to an elderly person with a bad hearing aid) to play a particular song that I like, the Google Home is way ahead. I can't compare how each works with smart home devices because I haven't installed that feature yet, and even if the AmzEcho is ahead of the game as far as being able to connect with more devices, I would sacrifice having the few devices that the Ggl Home does works with, just because it's the more responsive device. I like the fact that after you ask the Ggl Home to play a particular song for you, it continues to play similar songs to the previous song you requested, that's cool, it doesn't do that on the echo(it just plays the one song you requested).
reviews.author: Blackhorse20

reviews.title: "Fantastic Assistant"
reviews.text:
Google Home is an unobtrusive little speaker tower that sits happily on my kitchen buffet waiting for instruction. Any questions that I have are quickly answered by a pleasant female voice...”Hey Google, what is the weather forecast today?” 
“The forecast for Georgetown is....” . As I wrapped presents, I said, “Hey Google, play holiday music”, and Bing Crosby started crooning. Hey Google, turn down music... my wish is her command. Hey Google, turn on rock music in The guest bedroom... Hey Google, turn on the light in the bedroom... I can see the possibilities are endless when paired with the many Google Home products that are compatible with this marvelous home assistant..
reviews.author: HandyBecky

reviews.title: "Great Product!"
reviews.text: Helps me with everyday things from turning on my lights to telling me the weather.  Google.com
reviews.author: Alexbob

reviews.title: "Google Home is great for the kitchen! Love it!"
reviews.text: I did an unboxing video for this product to show how easy it is to get setup and using it. It's literally plug and play. The app you use is super easy - the only trick is that you need a gmail account to get going but I had that so it was easy - I just had to login. I put this unit in my kitchen and I use it all the time - way more than I thought it would. Telling Google to play music is one of my favorites - I use different streaming services. Asking if the place I want to eat is still open. Checking traffic before I leave for work - telling Google to add something to my grocery list. Asking what time it is. There are so many things. Asking Google to tell me a joke. The list goes on and on. I set up my smart home features so I can change my thermostat and turn lights on and off. If you want easy access to an assistant this is it! I highly recommend this product.
reviews.author: candy1land

reviews.title: "Google Home"
reviews.text: I highly recommend this product. Google Home is so easy to setup. All you have to do is download Google Home in your App Store (for apple) and Google Store (for android). From there it syncs the device to your home WiFi router and it's smooth sailing from there on out. You can set reminders, play any music, ask the Google home pretty much anything. I have this one located in my kitchen. Thanks Lowes and Google!
reviews.author: Adam

reviews.title: "Good Product"
reviews.text: The Google Home is a good small speaker system. The sound is good and the volume can be adjusted from very low to very loud and the sound is good at all levels. The volume is controlled by voice or by a finger on top of the device. Clockwise increases volume and counterclockwise decreases the volume. There is a pause button in the middle of the top. There is also a mic off button on the back of the device. The device is approx. 6x4x4 inches but has very rich sound for such a small speaker. The Google assistant is very entertaining to use and can provide almost anything you can ask on the Google search website. The speaker was easy to setup with the Google Home app and all you do with the speaker is plug it in to an outlet. It works with most of the music services but not with Amazon Prime. I recommend this device to anyone who loves music and likes to ask Google a lot of questions.
reviews.author: Mandrake

reviews.title: "Fantastic smart home device!!"
reviews.text: I love the Google home system. Not only does it look great but it sounds great when you are playing music through it. You can put one in each room and play music throughout your whole house so you never miss a beat while you are doing your housework. If you don't want to give vocal commands, it does have a switch to turn off the microphone. The app is great and easy to use so set up is quick so you can get back to what you want to do. It sound just a good as my bose and it has fantastic bass. I love these speakers. You can also control you lamps with you voice so no more trying to find a light switch in the dark. The Google home system is a must have and makes a perfect gift for anyone!!
reviews.author: Unicorn241982

reviews.title: "Very cool device"
reviews.text: This is my first experience with any of these smart home devices. I gotta say that they are pretty cool and capable of doing a lot. Initial setup was very simple, I had it up and running in about 10 minutes. It weighs maybe 3lbs and feels built well. It is actually able to connect to my LG TV and control a lot of features on it. The main reason why I give it 4 stars and not 5 is the lack of instructions. The box basically comes with an instruction manual that was a few pictures showing what to do and that was it. Setting it up to connect to my TV and control it, like raising the volume, playing Youtube, etc, took me about 2 hours to figure out. I eventually figured it out but there are still some issues. Again, trying to find guides online was very difficult as there were not many. Until Google starts generating some better-detailed guides, I cannot give it 5 stars, however, I do recommend it.
reviews.author: SquaredAway249

reviews.title: "Google Home"
reviews.text: First off let's start off with stating my tech skills, it is moderate at best. I found the set up of this product very very easy to do. Simply download the app and plug in the Home. Follow the questions on the app and just like that you have all the features. In no time at all I was playing music from the speaker. I am just hitting the tip of the iceberg on all the different features. I can get sporting scores updates. Temperature and weather forecast are as easy as "hey google what is the temperature outside". I would recommend this to anyone if you have WiFi access in your home/apartment. I can't wait to expand my uses for the Google Home and add additional items for the unit to control.
reviews.author: Greg

reviews.title: "Not bad, but the Echo is better"
reviews.text: I tried both the Amazon Echo and Google Home. I found the Google Home to be slower than Echo. I also found the Echo did not answer as many questions, although I found Google Home getting many questions incorrect. This caused me frustration. I would hear an answer but the answer seemed off. I would look it up online to find out the correct answer. I also was surprised the Google Home did not support Insteon. I could not control any of my smart switches with Google Home while the Echo worked flawlessly.
reviews.author: Bob

reviews.title: "Really Easy to set up and fun, very useful..."
reviews.text: Just to set this up properly, I am a baby boomer who knew dial up modems and rotary phones. This system is super intuitive and very easy to install and set up using your existing Internet provider (ISP). Using Apps to set up takes maybe 10 mins max. Once set up, it is fun to use and when cooking with hands covered in dough, asking it to set up a timer or continue instructions on a recipe (yes it can do that) is great. Add in me being lazy and asking for a forecast or outside air temp just completes the usefulness. It will also expand and link to TV and allow voice commands or phone app commands for starting / stopping video, music, photos etc....just starting to figure out those many options.
reviews.author: TJ

reviews.title: "Google Home"
reviews.text: Okay the design is sleek and it's got a modern look to it so it fits in any space. You can interchange the bottom base color standard comes in grey. Its top touch allows you to turn volume up and down in a circular motion and then touch to pause and resume music which is pretty convenient and easy to use. The only reason I didn't give it a five star was because it actual went down on me one day and I couldn't tell why (if this happens just unplug for 10 seconds and plung back in and it should work), then also if you have several of these throughout the house in a bit of a close proximity they all answer when you say Hey Google. It would be nice to have a call out like Hey Kitchen Google, Livinging Room Google etc to distinguish which specific Google you want to talk to. But overall this is a really good product and I like it in the kitchen to ask questions for recipes, ideas for dinner, and tell a joke when I need to laugh.
reviews.author: DT

reviews.title: "Google Home"
reviews.text: The Google Home was easy to install using the Google App on my smart phone. We installed this in our great room. We have an ever changing musical concert in the house most of the day. We also use it to find out about the weather, set an alarm when we have an appointment, and use it to get all kinds of information. If we are going to a nearby attraction we can ask how far and long to get there. Very handy to have and easy to install and use. We're going to connect it with our smart TV but haven't yet. Love this thing.
reviews.author: Ned-44

reviews.title: "Google home"
reviews.text: I love the google home. It was easy to set up after I downloaded the google home app. I just followed the directions and in a few minutes, i was listening to music. My wife likes it because she can ask it about the weather and other things. I was surprised how good, the speaker sounds,when it plays music. The unit itself is not very big, but the sound is very good. It is supposed to be able to make phone calls for you, but we haven't figured out how to do that yet,im sure we are doing so little thing wrong. My son has the echo,but i like this one better. I think it will do more things.
reviews.author: Jim

reviews.title: "Great Google Smart product"
reviews.text: This is a GREAT product. Small, discreet and not an eye sore. Very easy to setup, takes maybe 2 minutes. Most importantly, it's very easy to use. You don't have to speak loudly for it to hear you. I also have 2 Home Mini's and a Home Max spread throughout the house. You'll need to download the Google Home App to control and even create a group with whatever speakers you choose to play music on. The sound on this product is good, not great. It's little speakers so what do you expect. There are alot of features and it seems like there's more coming. Again I say, this is a GREAT product!
reviews.author: Taz

reviews.title: "Google Home"
reviews.text:
I was skeptical at first as I have rarely seen advertising for the Google Home. But after checking reviews I was surprised at the positive comments. 
My observations. First I was pleased at the minimal packaging what wasn't recyclable. I plugged in the unit, downloaded the app and created an gmail account. Using the app to set up the home was easy. It took less than ten minutes and the Google Home was set up and ready to go. Response time was excellent and volume control easy. I located this unit in my kitchen and have used it for music (I use Pandora) but almost any streaming service works. Recipes were easy to follow as I do the cooking. Day by day I find more reasons to be happy with my purchase.
reviews.author: JimS

reviews.title: "Its ok."
reviews.text: When this first came out, I thought, holy cow this is great and I can't wait to get one. Now that I have one, its like, ok now what. It was easy to set up and a breeze to maintain. I managed to link it to my nest locks and thermostats. After making sure everything worked properly, I started asking some generic questions which were answered pretty easy. I wanted to play my iTunes library through it but found out you could not do that which I find very disappointing. Ok, so after asking a bunch of questions, finding out the weather and it telling me some jokes, what do I do with it?
reviews.author: Bo

reviews.title: "Incredible Control"
reviews.text: I've only scratched the surface with the Google Home. First, its voice is very realistic. I expected something on the order of a GPS voice. In fact, it sounds so real that after asking it for the weather, or to set an alarm, I'm tempted to say "Thank you", following its response. I tried all the different voices, but the default is best. As a stand-alone music player it sounds very good. I removed the radio from the area. I'm impressed with its music library and happy that Google does not charge for that service. I also asked it to tell a joke or two and they were the kind that the kids can listen to. All in all, this is the kind of product that once you try it, you won't want to do without it. It is well made and somewhat heavy for its size. It is unobtrusive and looks nice enough to be placed anywhere. And, finally, though it is useful for anyone to have, it probably would be great for the elderly or handicapped. I like the Google Home and will enjoy many moments learning about it and asking it more and more questions.
reviews.author: Alrod50

reviews.title: "Super product"
reviews.text: This base has a great rich sound. It performs all of the things expected out of a google product and more. We have been very pleased with the performance and each day, we are finding more and more uses for it. We are very happy and satisfied with the google home.
reviews.author: JEB

reviews.title: "Google Home"
reviews.text: I have given this 2 stars because it does not come with instructions other than plug it in, go to website. It seems everything anymore requires the user to download and print instructions. I have decided anything that does this to me gets no more than 2 stars. I should not have to spend additional monies (internet. printer, paper, etc.) to get something to function. In addition, I found no anti hacking safety, nor did I find anything that prevents others from listening in to conversations in the household. I suppose that if one had a huge house and needed to spend additional money for subscriptions to music apps etc., it might be okay. But this provides nothing I can't get online from (gulp) cable or Sirius radio at less cost.
reviews.author: Rick

reviews.title: "Google home the better alternative"
reviews.text: Google home is great with voice recognition. Calling by WiFi. Emergency services not available yet.
reviews.author: CHRISTOPHER

reviews.text: Works with Smartthings outta the box! Great voice command assistant to control all the Z-wave devices throughout the house! "Hey Google, lets watch Sherlock on livingroom TV" voila! Chromecast starts playing next episode from where you left off!
reviews.author: Ty

reviews.title: "Hey Google, thanks!"
reviews.text: Nice speaker, for small room is the best choice, decent features.She can advance your enjoy with music services like Spotify, Google Music etc. Need to understand that google home is still updating and new things are waiting, i.e. recent update that released pairing by bluetooth.
reviews.author: SunnyPRO

reviews.title: "Google Home the start of my smart home!"
reviews.text:
Google Home is a breeze to setup using a downloadable phone app. I was really surprised how sensitive the microphone on it is; it picks up commands from 20 feet away using my normal voice. We have it in our kitchen and my wife loves how easy it is to get recipes or to place an order for home pizza delivery. The speaker included plays YouTube music without distortion. It also controls your thermostat with the optional Nest hardware and your lighting with the Google Mini. 
I could go on and on, but I'm glad I've added this to our home and I highly recommend it.
reviews.author: RoyMd

reviews.title: "Best automation Gadget"
reviews.text: Helpful in many ways in automation during our busy schedule! Gives more information with single question! Can incorporate more features and easy accessibility without paid subscription!
reviews.author: Sap

reviews.title: "working so far"
reviews.text: I haven't yet made full use of all it can do.  Mostly now I'm using it for music as I have Google Play music service.  Since I listen to mostly Hawaiian music, it sometimes has difficulty understanding.  The sound is pretty amazing considering the size of the speaker.  I've also connected it to a smartplug to control a roof gable light and it's working for that.  I'll be adding more smart things in the near future for other things.
reviews.author: TheCeladon

reviews.title: "Great product individually and as a group"
reviews.text: I think I am one of the perfect people to review this product. I was an Amazon Alexa person / household for many years.it wasn't until recently with the new home hub and show that interested me in either expanding my products around the house or converting to the Google brand. With this offer I am a convert. I received the Google products and started to set them up around the house ,moving and changing some as I got more used to them. With all this the app for the products is great and very easy to use. That was one problem I did not like about the Alexa too much to jump through to get the skills. This was the first time for me to set multiple products up and set up different speaker groups was great. Highly recommend all parts of the Google home line.
reviews.author: Machristy

reviews.title: "Great sounding Home"
reviews.text:
This is a great sounding speaker. I use it in my kitchen and it's perfect for listening to music or the news ...it's a great assisant for recipes and as a timer. It's unobtrusive on the counter. I have this Home synced with my Home Max in the living room and the mini in my bedroom. They're my new favorite toys in the house! I've even purchased the minis as Christmas gifts. 
I really think that if you want a great quality sounding WiFi gadget that the Home is perfect. It's affordable, the bass sounds great! Makes a great gift too!
reviews.author: Aya

reviews.title: "Super assistant"
reviews.text:
This is a hundred times better than the old "clapper" sold on TV. PLUS it can do so much more. 
I am 75 years old and my daughter had given me one of these from Amazon last Christmas and after trying to set it up almost a year ago . . It was unplugged and I lost interest. It was too difficult to set up for a senior without help. THE GOOGLE HOME however has thus far been easy to set up by myself and I can see where it can make my life alot easier. I received this item to review and will be adding more comments on the additional accessories I also received to review as I get them added into the setup. It appears that Google HOME has more home accessories to help organize your home. I can hardly wait to have everything in place. This is something to get excited about!
reviews.author: InkysMom

reviews.title: "It's very limited outside supported countries"
reviews.text: Won't set reminders, won't make phone calls.  All clearly explained by Google, but a shame nonetheless.  Otherwise good for playing some music, hearing news, as a good separate speaker, for web lookups and searches.
reviews.author: sp

reviews.title: "Great Product"
reviews.text:
I really like Google Home, because I think it would suit anyone. 
It's big enough to have good sound for listening to music. 
And it's small enough to fit in any setting and decor. It doesn't need much shelf or table space.
The touch controls are super accessible on this device. Sometimes I'd rather adjust the volume manually,
instead of giving a verbal command.
I appreciate being able to easily turn off the microphone, too.
The design of the rubber base, and the way the unit is weighted, makes it super stable.
reviews.author: Jerry

reviews.title: "Modern Convenience"
reviews.text: This is a handy little device if you want to know the weather or the traffic in your area or have it find facts or look up information on the internet without having to use a computer. It will also sing happy birthday to you on your birthday when you wake it up. If you install other smart devices in your home like lights, locks, thermostats or sprinklers, you can control those devices through the speaker as well. It is a great device for lazy people that don't want to get up and flip a switch, lock a door or adjust the thermostat. But it can also be a great assistant to disabled persons that are unable to easily perform those functions. Personally, I am a bit leery of it being hacked and then have someone spying on me like they have done with nanny cams and baby monitors.
reviews.author: JaJu

reviews.title: "Very Functional"
reviews.text: My Google Home is very functional and a great addition to my "smart home" that includes smart lights, a Home Max, several mini's, Google wireless router and chromecast. It's great for music in our family room, turning on/off lights, reminders and for general information like weather and appointments. It even helps my grand children with their homework! This is a very versatile product and works seamlessly with my other smart products. The set up was very easy with the Google app. I think it's a must have item.
reviews.author: Trapper-John

reviews.title: "Great product"
reviews.text: This google home is the one that I would definitely recommend over the others. It's like the in between of the 3 (being the mini and the max). It is louder then the mini while being much smaller and sleeker then the max. I think it is great for a smart home system. If anyone is thinking about getting into virtual assistants, this is the one to go for. Note: it doesn't seem to have the problem the google max does with shutting down my WiFi, it's my preferred google smart home system to use.
reviews.author: Cameron

reviews.title: "Google Home"
reviews.text: Love this addition; didn't know I needed it until I got it.  Very easy to get information (weather, trivia, etc.) just by asking questions as they arise.  Also love the music function.
reviews.author: RobertIII

reviews.title: "Easy& quick set-up"
reviews.text: The first thing about all of Google's products is the packaging they are putting together is amazing. Also, there are no ridiculously complex manuals with a bunch of mundane instructions. You take it out, there is the device, a power cord and a few cards with some basic straightforward directions. Once I was plugged in this was up and going within a minute. Just launch your Google home app and add the device, if there are updates there may be a few minutes until you can use. Very impressed by its ability to recognize what I say,the only thing I do not like is that when I say "Ok Google" my phone is usually near me so it starts its voice recognition as well. Speaker is quite clear for its size as well. I have yet to really use to its fullest but cannot wait to see what other tips and tricks it can do.
reviews.author: JMc

reviews.title: "NOT Home Alone Anymore"
reviews.text: Great standalone device to answer your questions but even better as your home automation hub. Use it with other devices (I received Google products) but understand that it is usable with some other brands as well to control lights and appliances, listen to music around the house, control the thermostat, security devices, etc. Pairing with other Google products is very simple. Would recommend for even the most novice and - if you need help to make it work - ask one of the grandkids.
reviews.author: LugNutz

reviews.title: "Powerful Vibes"
reviews.text: This product is easy setup and performs well....The speaker for being small has the sound of a much larger speaker with very good quality...It picks up your voice very good even in a large room...This powerful device can do numerous tasks and control your home making you the “King Of The Couch”...With so many tasks it can do and great speaker quality this device will be the missing link in your home that you have been looking for.....You will be asking “Hey Google Whats The Price”?
reviews.author: Smoky40

reviews.title: "Not as good as Echo"
reviews.text: It is slower than the Amazon Echo. I found that Echo doesn't always have an answer, but Google almost always has an answer but it is wrong often times. Also Google cannot control my Insteon smart switches.
reviews.author: Bob

reviews.title: "Super cool device"
reviews.text: I gave this to my mother because she is bedridden. The setup of Google home was very simple. Voice recognition worked well even with my mothers light voice. I also set up outlet plugs so she can turn on lights. She was so thrilled that she is able to do this. She spent a lot of time exploring its functionality. I like that you can expand it with mini's into other rooms. The speaker had really nice sound for her music choices. I have used Alexa but actually prefer the Google Home.
reviews.author: rubberwheel

reviews.title: "Quality smart device"
reviews.text:
This is the middle sized home. I have the max and the mini too And I would say for the money,
this one is the best value. It has all the features that you want from the home, and the sound quality is very good. I am not a tech nerd and I am probably only using a fraction of its capabilities. I'm working on it and also I want to get some more smart lightbulbs. That's one of my favorite features of this product is it can turn on and off lights with your voice. I like it.
reviews.author: Aardvarkf111d

reviews.title: "Nice assistant and features"
reviews.text: Google home is a nice product. Well built, good sound, and nice to use. Takes some time to get used to. With smart bulbs, you can control lights, sold separately. Addditional chromecast module is compatible making your television into a smart tv, with voice command features. One can have two and play music through out your home by making a speaker group, or can be used individually, which makes a nice option for use. Enjoying the upgrade as my home feels a bit smarter.
reviews.author: Swaz

reviews.title: "Google Home Makes Life More Convenient"
reviews.text: Amazing technology in this unit. Connected to the internet it is unlimited in what you can get answers to. Weather, news, dictionary, encyclopedia - just unlimited ! Streaming music and some talk radio is what is a very convenient function. The quality of the sound is very good. We have also used it as a kitchen timer and most useful to us is the ability to create a shopping list, just keep adding items as you find you need. Very handy item, I would recommend this!
reviews.author: RA255

reviews.title: "Amazing product for every home"
reviews.text:
It came packaged very well!
I'll admit I wasn't familiar with the product. Upon using it after such an easy set up, which is done through your iPhone or android, I was so impressed! This little device connects to all the other devices that go with google home. We can walk into our home and with one sentence all our music and or lights turn on in either one or several rooms because they can sync to one another. Great product over all for your home or as a gift.
reviews.author: Lori24

reviews.title: "Google Home"
reviews.text:
I have this product in the Kitchen. It is great all I have to do is say Hey Google play Christmas Music, or Hey Google play Country Music. It makes being in the Kitchen while cooking great. I can say turn light on in the bedroom and it magically comes on. Wow, what a product. Before I didn't have anything like this.

This product is small and can be located anywhere.

I love this product and would recommend it, family and friends. 

Kaye Cooper
reviews.author: aukfan2

reviews.title: "Google home is fun"
reviews.text:
The Google Home is sleek and fits well into any decor. As with all of the Google products, it needs WiFi and to be paired up with a phone or tablet and requires the Google Home App. It takes a few minutes to set up the first product, but adding additional products is fairly easy. 

This is a fun, handy little device that can answer questions, give the weather, play music, etc. I would recommend this or any of the minis. While I have not done so yet, I see there are possibilities to expand other items with use of WiFi outlet adapters. Use of hands free devices such of this can be handy at times.

My only concerns might be security ( but you do have the option of shutting off the mic) and that adding many of these priducts might use up a lot of or slow down the WiFi. I'm curious about later adding the hub and a doorbell device, however.
reviews.author: SharonS

reviews.title: "Best smart speaker"
reviews.text: I like Google Home better than Alexa because it is cheaper and better integrates with Google searches. I think Google home will catch up and beat Amazon Alexa very quickly.
reviews.author: Aziz

reviews.title: "Great Home assistant"
reviews.text: Just used the Google Home for a short time and I'm very impressed, started with the ease of set up, just in a few minutes I was asking Google for the weather, turning on & off my lights and listening to music, I can also hook up with my Nest products and control either by voice or my phone. You do need to speak clearly when asking Google for assistants, and if you like you can even ask Google to make phone calls from your contact list.
reviews.author: ssjimmy

reviews.title: "Google 'HOME' unit"
reviews.text: This product from google is the "HOME" unit, It is basically a speaker system for Wi-Fi. It also has an assistant. I do have the mini which I use in another room. The system works well and is a lot of fun. My husband ranks as chief in regards to the speaker system! I'd recommend this product. Well built and I assume it will last a very long time until some updated technology is added in the future as with any system.
reviews.author: Ninzo

reviews.title: "Quality Device"
reviews.text:
While the Google Home is an excellent device, it is hard to justify spending the extra money over a Google Home Mini. The Google Home has better sound, but has the same functionality of the Mini.
The device setup is easy using the Google Home app available for Android and iPhone users. You can control compatible device such as lights or TV. Of course, you can ask Google about anything and get an answer immediately.
reviews.author: Jeffrey

reviews.title: "Hard to differentiate from the Google Mini"
reviews.text:
I now have three Google Home Mini units, this Home unit and a Home Max. I, so far, haven't been able to differentiate them other than sound quality and while the Max has clearly the best quality it's not up to par for complex, large group music. It needs a much better equalizer.

I'm also running two Wi-Fi networks - my original one on an Acer router and a new one on the Google Home router. That is working very well although I had to buy an extra Google router to get adequate coverage in my 1220 square foot home. Of note, the Acer router doesn't do any better reaching the farthest room.

What would be exceptional is if Google enabled device to device communications so that at a minimum you could send messages to a device in another room and even better use VOIP to set up a home intercom system.

Overall I like the Google Home setup with the exceptions noted above.
reviews.author: dtSeattle

reviews.title: "I enjoy using them,,,they are so helpful."
reviews.text: Ive used my google home for about 6 months, then bought 2 minis for the bedroom.   Google can answer almost any question, about weather,,destinations,,and local business... I use it to play the sounds at night to sleep by,,like water falls, or ocean, and it gives me reminders of things i need to purchase.  I feel like this is by far the most useful purchase I have made.. Im very happy with it.. thank you, Google
reviews.author: bobtenn

reviews.title: "Easy Quick Setup"
reviews.text: This is the second Google Device I have set up. I chose to put this one in our shop so I can listen to music while I'm working on projects. For the size of the home device the power is amazing. The sound is perfectly clear, no echo, no static. Set up was just as simple as the Google WiFi, like wise the update of software took the longest. I was able to add the Google Home to the music group I created so all devices play the same music at the same time. I can not believe how amazing these are. When I want to listen to music or stop it I simply say Hey Google, play our YouTube music. I would definitely purchase one of these. If I had not received it as a free product from Lowe's & Google. I'm sure in the future I will be getting another one to add to the rooms. After, setting everything up I still can't believe how simple and wuick set up was, and how fantastic the sound is!!
reviews.author: KandieWood

reviews.title: "Google Home Better Sound"
reviews.text: We have several Google Home Minis and find them very useful for shopping lists, play music or Cast music on Chrome Audio, control the thermostats in the house, weather forecasts and looking up general information on the web.  The Google home has all the same features as the Minis but with better sound.  We find this particular useful in our kitchen when we don't have a speakers from our larger audio system.
reviews.author: Joe

reviews.title: "What's not to like?"
reviews.text: Easy setup via the google home app. I set mine up in the kitchen. It is out of the way and great for music while cooking or setting a timer without having to wash your hand before pushing buttons on the microwave or stove. It also acts as a great conversation starter. I've only had mine a short time and I'm sure there are so many other uses I have not even thought of yet.
reviews.author: MikeC

reviews.title: "Google Home Speaker"
reviews.text: The google home speaker is a nice addition to the other google products I have. The sound quality is better then the home mini, but still no better then above average. Like with the other google devices, the google assistant is what makes this device supreme. From checking your calendar, to asking random questions, it's always fun having a google assistant device around.
reviews.author: Knonchalant

reviews.title: "The Google home"
reviews.text: The setup of the Google home is extremely easy as is all the Google Minis and max that I have in have created group speakers which is a great feature so that you can listen to music through the whole house if you like without having the volume to high. Wish the quality of the speaker was slightly better but not bad the minis are pretty close to the same quality of sound
reviews.author: Kona

reviews.title: "Fun device"
reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical a first, but the Google Home device has proved to be a nice addition. My family has been playing music through voice command, asking random questions, and adjusting the light in our living room daily now. The speaker has a nice sound and the device compliments the other Google products. The device was a breeze to set up and works with my phone.
reviews.author: Reviewer

reviews.title: "1st Google"
reviews.text:
This is my first entry into this type of service or item. Packaging was solid and set up was also easy. Down loaded the Google app on my tablet. Followed the set up and was using it right away. I set my voice to the unit and started asking it to play certain music. It would say “ that station is only on Google play but we will play this”. In most cases it would play some songs but not all. I looked into Google Play and signed up for the 30 day trial of music. It is $9.99 per month after. Have been listening to all sorts of music from Christmas, jazz, country, oldies to Dean Martin! Love it !!! Also have asked for local weather and weather in other areas, time, stock prices and even asking it to repeat words in Polish so I can learn. I have not connected any other items to it but look forward to that opportunity in the future. 
This is a great time we live in and this Google Home is a great addition to our home and comfort we enjoy.
reviews.author: Joe

reviews.text: I like the stylish look of my new Google Home. Easy to set up and responds well. I like the touch volume on the top of the unit as well. Makes it easy to adjust without interrupting the music. I enjoy the sound quality in this small profile unit. Hook it up and "Hey Google" your needs. Check the weather, set a timer, or a reminder for an appointment.
reviews.author: Frank

reviews.title: "Very good for certain purposes"
reviews.text:
As part of a fairly complete suite of Google Home devices, the Google Home serves quite well, in my opinion, for several personal assistant-like and smart home functions. That is, although sound has been improved, it is still not quite up to that of it's major competitor, and linking several Google Home devices to play the same input at the same time [grouped or whole house] isn't quite as simple as in the 'competitor'. On the other hand, it is somewhat easier to link to my personal music library, when loaded to Google Drive, a major obstacle now with the competitor eliminating ability to store a library with them.

Functionality as a smart home controller/input device is flawless, and in fact seems much more time-responsive than the prevalent competing devices, which lately seem to be lagging between command and smart device actuation. With few exceptions, almost all of the smart devices installed can be controlled by either system, which does provide me with redundancy.. The one exception is a bundled "GE" smart light bulb, that I can only control via Google, unless I want to write an IFTTT {as I understand it} routine for the other system. One stand-out is its interaction with my smart thermostat, which is much more intuitive. It is solely also capable of controlling the Chromecast device, in many ways, to include voice commands for those services which the Chromecast is enabled. (See my Chromecast review for more).

To me, the one other lack with regard to playing music, is that the Google Home devices cannot be wire-connected to either a powered speaker set or full audio system, having to link via Bluetooth. While for many this is preferable anyway, I personally am not a fan of creating a large paired set of devices to have access to a playback means. Also, I would think, but do not know for sure, that there will be even further audio spectrum clipping due to bandwidth limitations.

Oh, and one other function where it excels, is obviously direct access to Google Search and stored data functions. There is not as extensive a skills library, and the one entertainment app I've used seems a bit 'hokey' - the trivia game "show". 

Again, it is a very capable device and system, and I generally like it. For one who is not a "Prime" member, it is a definite alternative to the major competitor, and as in a facility or home running both systems, it serves as both a niche and alternative system quite well. [One niche example is that I have only Google Home devices (a 'Mni' & light bulbs) in my basement where I no longer entertain. I could later add a Bluetooth adapter, should I decide I wanted to stream music via the Google device there.

In short, again, recommended and quite capable system that just would not be a total solution for me, but could well be for others.
reviews.author: Mike

reviews.title: "Still surprising me with more capabilities"
reviews.text: Besides all the things that are advertised, it has excelled past expectations. I have a large shop, so I put the Home Max at one end and the Home at the other end. I asked a question of the Google Home on my way to the middle of the room. The Google Home Max answered. I guess I didn't think about them being connected to each other.... duh! :)
reviews.author: CptOrion

reviews.title: "Small but Powerful"
reviews.text:
Having seen commercials for Google Home, and purchasing a Amazon's Alexa product for a family member, I was somewhat aware of what this could do, and I had some ideas about what I wanted to be able to do with it. 

Setup:
Setup is very easy, using the Google Home app, which is available for almost any device. Similar to the Google Chromecast setup you have to connect to it directly, and then I had zero issues getting it to connect to my home network. Once it shows up on your network you can also control it and add connections to other services via the Home app. 

Connectivity:
The Google home connected to my wifi with minimal fuss and seems to keep that connection well. In the Home App is also where you set the Google Home to connect to various services and devices you have around your home. In my case I connected it to other Chromecasts, and Spotify., These were all done using authentication through those sites themselves, via the Google Home app. This was also fairly easy to accomplish. 

Use:
Once I got it all set up... I wasn't quite sure what to do. I thought right away we'd use it to play music. It took a few tries, without opening any manuals or instructions, to get it to play music from spotify. It responds to both "Hey Google' or "OK Google" When you say OK Google it reduces the volume of anything that's already playing. It's surprisingly sensitive, responding to me from two rooms away at a conversational volume. It obviously applies some kind of noise cancelling to it's own tunes because it's able to respond to me in the same room with it playing music at almost full volume. It does struggle a little more with accuracy in that situation however.

Sound Quality:
This thing is on par for similar devices on the market. It turns up way louder than anything it's size has any business putting out. It didn't' distort or drop out at any level. Stereo is a little tricky since the speakers are mounted inside in an opposing fashion. 

Design: The google home looks like a vase with the top chopped off. There I said it. The top is angled, and for a reason: there are LEDs under the top. You can actually use touches to accomplish different things, tapping to stop music, tapping again to play. There is a circle of LEDs that show when Google Home is listening for a command (in the same primary color array as Google Chrome) and there is also a circle of LEDs showing current volume and you can touch to turn up or down. The ability to swap out the bottom/speaker grills to match your decor is a nice touch too. Mine was a pretty good fit right out of the box. 

Overall:
This thing is probably only going to become MORE useful as a smart home hub as the technology evolves and google adds more services to it. Right now you could connect MANY things to it. The number of services it connects to out of the box are useful, but not plentiful. So far it's served as a glorified speaker. Exploring in the Google Home app also gives you more examples of what can be done with it. As it is, I really like using it, and I think for the price point it blows the Alexa out of the water. Four our of Five stars, would recommend to a friend!
reviews.author: KJK

reviews.title: "Nice Google Home"
reviews.text: For the most parts it works good. Sometimes it gets confuse and won't answer the question. Music is really good also will find a radio station according to the song requested
reviews.author: Frank

reviews.title: "Google Home"
reviews.text:
For a smart home control, Google Home is no different in function as the Google Max and Google Mini; however, its design does allow it to it to fit nicely with other decors. Google seems to have designed the Google Home and the others to fill the needs according to the size of room that they are placed in; function wise, as far as I can tell, they work the same, however, the sound each produce does seem to increase as like their sizes.
The Google Home fills the musical needs of a small to medium size room perfectly; it will fill the room with music of your choice all day long. And when needed, it will allow you to control other smart home devices of your choosing.
The setup process is simple; that is, after you have been through the process setting up other Google smart home products. Google has never been great with clear instruction, and Google Home is not an exception, but as always Googling online is the best way to find answers for anything you may encounter.
reviews.author: SL

reviews.title: "Inovation"
reviews.text: I am not good with these new products so my Daughter had to get it up and running, and I am so happy that she did! this product is great, the sound coming out of it when it plays music is incredible. Now that it is hooked up it is in constent use. I am now going into the future and I am enjoying it. Thank You Google!
reviews.author: Skip

reviews.title: "Amazing product"
reviews.text: Can't say that I have been fired up for one of these but now that I have it it's amazing! First of all it's super easy to set up and easy to use. I didn't know how to set up the Bluetooth pairing but turns out just say “google Bluetooth pairing “ and it tells you how to do the rest. Only downside here is that Apple Music can't be your default streaming music but you can just pair your phone or tablet with Bluetooth and stream Apple Music that way. Speakers sound great , good way to listen to music, it's a plus, I didn't expect the sound quality to be that good. Voice recognition is much better than Siri I think. I have a little Southern accent and sometimes Siri gives me weird responses to things. If you are interested in getting into smart home then this is a good start. It's stying is very unobtrusive and I'm sure I will learn how to do more things as I use it. I like that you can tell it to creat a list and then it will show up in your phone app , pretty convenient.

reviews.title: "Great Little Speaker"

We put this in the bedroom and use it to turn the lights on and off, listen to the news in the morning, and play gentle rain sounds to fall asleep to. The speaker has good tone, and you can turn the Mic off with a switch if you want complete privacy.

reviews.title: "Google Home (chalk)"
reviews.text:
Our home has been an Amazon Echo home since it's arrival on the market. However, since obtaining the Google Home, I have been pleasantly surprised how equally adept it is at having many of the same capabilities as the Echo. It is esthetically pleasing to look at and fits into our decor nicely. It works in the same manner as the Google Mini and Google Max, answering pretty much all queries, supply weather updates, calendar activities, reminders, play music, games, control homes devices such as smart bulbs and plugs as well as thermostats, and on and on.
In all honesty, there are things the Google devices cannot do that the Echo can, and visa versa. I'm still learning the nuances of the Google home, so it is a learning experience for the user as well.
I would recommend the Google Home to perspective buyers,
I'm unsure if the Google devices can track a package much like the Echo can when you order from Amazon. If I learn how to set that feature, if it exists right now. I'll add a note to my review in the future.

reviews.title: "Works fantastically well"

reviews.title: "Very helpful"
reviews.text: Love the Google Home! It was very easy to connect to wifi and other smart products. It is very helpful to access information such as store and restaurant closings, etc. We are in our mid 60's with no “ tech” qualifications and it is so easy to use. Highly recommend!

reviews.title: "Google Home Very Useful"

reviews.author: Linda

reviews.title: "Great Product"

Great sound for its size, slick design, if you are only getting one google home speaker this is the one you want.
The only complaint I have is that you have to have a smart device to set it up.
Overall it is a great product, I would recommend it to a friend.
reviews.author: DIYCedarGuy

reviews.title: "A helpful device."
reviews.text:
Google Home: Beautiful design and intuitive controls. We decided to put this one in the kitchen and having the touch controls on the top was very useful. You can pause it by tapping it, and control the volume like you would on an old iPod click wheel. Setup was very simple. My phone recognized that there was a device nearby and sent me a notification to set it up without having to go through any menus or anything. We especially appreciate that it can now read recipes to you step by step, as I have a tendency to lose my place when trying to cook and read a recipe at the same time. My only complaint is with the speaker itself. It is very bass-heavy, and with the 360 degree speaker design, the sound tends to get muffled when it is placed against the wall. We originally put it under the cabinet against the backsplash, but it sounded underwater, even when we tweaked the EQ. If you move it away from the wall and other objects that might absorb or deflect the music, it sounds fantastic. Just be careful about where you put it. 
4/5
reviews.author: Jack

reviews.title: "Great start to a smart home"
reviews.text: Google Home is voice activated device much like other competitors except with much more capability. One of the first things you'll want to do is download the google home app on your smartphone and or tablet, this will not only make set up easy but also serve for more advanced use of all the features. The limits for using google home is pretty much your own imagination. Task like setting alarms or timers, listening to the news or music, making shopping or to do list, checking the calendar and making appointments, GTSing (google that stuff) questions, the list goes on. Other things we have enjoyed is linking to other smart devices in the house like thermostat and refrigerator. Television is another avenue we are just beginning to explore so not much detail yet but we're interested in linking google home to the sound system and exploring chromecast. At this point we've been well pleased with google home and can't wait to implement more smart options like lighting control, cameras and more! We would definitely recommend google home!
reviews.author: NCRocky

reviews.title: "Google Home"
reviews.text: Simple set-up and easy to follow instructions. I use it in the bedroom to set a wake up alarm, play music and get the weather forecast. I figure that I am only scratching the surface of the possibilities of usage. I am satisfied with the Google Home.

reviews.author: Yolenc

reviews.title: "Welcome HOME"
reviews.text:
Well, this is a really cool item for your automated home.

 So far, I have been able to connect this item to all of the electric and smart home products that I have within my home. The connections have remained stable, and in fact I have even been able to better configure my home products as a result of the required GOOGLE HOME app. the app can be downloaded via your favorite App Store.

Through the app you are able to easily connect this smart home controller to your home network, establish connections, and test to make sure everything works, one great thing is that once you have set up one Google Home product the next one is set up even easier. 

As far as which HOME product to choose - go with the one that best fits your decor and produces sound that is loud enough for you.

This device provides clear sound, enough for a bed room, kitchen, or bathroom for music listening purposes, but would not be the best choice for a living room solution.

My testing will continue and I will update my review if any of my opinions change. 

Thumbs up!

reviews.title: "Great Quality"
reviews.text:
This was my introduction to the Google Home products seen in all the electronics ads for the holidays. You can almost tell from the packaging that Google is putting their best foot forward with these products. The home was so easy to set up I thought I must have done something wrong. You download the Google Assistant App and it walks you through about 5 or 6 easy steps and you are done. The voice assistant is easy to understand and is more responsive than Alexa. I bought the Chalk colored model and it fits well with the furniture. It's hardly noticeable. I have been shopping for products that work with Google Assistant and the Home to fully use its capabilities. I have found there are over 5,000 different products that work with the Google products.
I also have a Google mini with a light bulb and that works with both. I can turn the light on or off with either of the Google or via the Google assistant app on my phone. I can tell this product is very expandable and has lots of uses. The speaker/microphone picks up my voice from anywhere in the room easily and the volume control is voice controlled. You can turn it up or down by simply telling it to raise or lower the volume. I'm looking forward to discovering all the possibilities.
